extension.name: JSON
extension.description: The JSON module contains tools to help you deal with JSON documents

operation.name: validateSchema
operation.description: Validates that the input content is compliant with a given schema. This operation supports referencing many schemas (using comma as a separator) which include each other.

parameter.name: schema
parameter.description: The location in which the schema to validate against is to be found. This attribute supports URI representations such as "http://org.mule/schema.json" or "resource:/schema.json". It also supports a most common classpath reference such as simply "schema.json".

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: the json document to be validated

parameter.name: schemaRedirects
parameter.description: Allows to redirect any given URI in the Schema (or even the schema location itself) to any other specific URI. The most common use case for this feature is to map external namespace URIs without the need to a local resource

parameter.name: dereferencing
parameter.description: Draft v4 defines two dereferencing modes: canonical and inline. CANONICAL will be the default option but INLINE can also be specified. When validating a v3 draft this attribute is ignored.

parameter.name: allowDuplicateKeys
parameter.description: if true, the validator will allow duplicate keys, otherwise it will fail.

type.name: org.mule.module.json.api.SchemaRedirect
type.description:
A redirection between a "from" and a "to" location
@since 1.0
